meanings.definition: To swallow greedily or in large amounts.
meanings.sent1: The hungry child was englutting the delicious cake at the party.
meanings.sent2: The bear was englutting the honey from the beehive.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was englutting its food so fast, it almost choked!
meanings.sent4: The vacuum cleaner seemed to be englutting everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The river englutted the debris after the heavy rain, causing a blockage.

meanings.definition: To consume or devour in a voracious manner.
meanings.sent1: The competitive eater was englutting hot dogs at an incredible speed.
meanings.sent2: The swarm of locusts was englutting the crops in the field.
meanings.sent3: The bookworm was englutting novels one after another during the summer break.
meanings.sent4: The fire seemed to be englutting everything in its path, leaving destruction behind.
meanings.sent5: The black hole appeared to be englutting stars and planets in the distant galaxy.
